N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 175.3 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) On duty. A
driver is on duty from the time he begins to work or is required to be in
readiness for work until the time he is relieved from work and all
responsibility for performing work, and includes time for meals. (b) Driving time. The term driving time
includes all time spent on a moving vehicle and any interval not in excess of
10 minutes in which a driver is on duty but not on a moving vehicle. (c) Off duty. The term off duty means free
and off the motor truck and/or motor bus and free from work of any kind in such
places and under such circumstances that rest and relaxation from the strain of
the duties of employment may be obtained. Time spent by a driver in a sleeper
berth in such vehicle shall not be considered off duty, but shall be considered
time on duty. Notes
